selected_quotes: Top #tweeted #RNA list story: Regulation of miRNA-146a and miRNA-150 Levels by … see more

citation.abstract:
Human papillomavirus type 16 (HPV16) induces various types of cancer in several locations. Microenvironmental microRNAs (miRNAs) such as miRNA-146a and miRNA-150 regulate cancer-associated inflammation and are involved in HPV-induced carcinogenesis. We studied the effects of celecoxib on the expression of these two miRNAs in HPV16-induced lesions.
Female transgenic (HPV16(+/-)) and wild-type (HPV16(-/-)) mice were administered 75 mg/kg/day celecoxib orally (treatment groups) or placebo (control groups) for four weeks. Skin samples were classified histologically, or used for miRNA analysis by quantitative real-time PCR.
HPV16(+/-) mice showed higher miRNA-146a and miRNA-150 expression levels compared to wild-type animals. Celecoxib further increased miRNA-150 (p<0.05) and miRNA-146a levels in treated animals. Celecoxib-treated HPV16(+/-) animals also showed reduced incidence of epidermal dysplasia and reduced inflammation, compared to untreated mice.
In this model, celecoxib may be able to regulate tumour-associated inflammation, through mechanisms involving the regulation of miRNA-146a and miRNA-150.
citation.journal: Anticancer Research: International Journal of Cancer Research and Treatment
citation.title: Regulation of miRNA-146a and miRNA-150 Levels by Celecoxib in Premalignant Lesions of K14-HPV16 Mice
